definition: flexible/to accommodate/to stretch or get around regulations/a short-term loan
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony

sentences.english: Be understanding if you or your loved one is upset.
sentences.chinese: 你或者你的摯愛焦躁時，要學着理解通融。

sentences.english: I accorded it, deeming that i did well in showing pliability on the point .
sentences.chinese: 我同意了，認爲自己在這一點上表示通融是做得對的。

sentences.english: We are sorry to say that we can't accommodate you with D/P payment terms.
sentences.chinese: 我方很遺憾地說，無法通融付款交單的支付條件。

sentences.english: We extend you this accommodation in view of our friendly relations.
sentences.chinese: 鑑於我們的友好關係，我們特作此項通融。

sentences.english: And of course, you need a hospital administration that is accommodating, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 當然你也需要醫院行政部門的通融，”她說道。

sentences.english: As much as we would like to accommodate you, Miss Roffe.
sentences.chinese: 我們是儘可能地通融遷就你的。

sentences.english: The so-called "accommodation" is the money for the director acquiescence .
sentences.chinese: 所謂的“通融”就是用金錢換取房產商的默許。

definition: open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to extend (a deadline etc)
to intercede/to plead for sb else
to let (sb) off/to let (sb) get away with sth
to give a favor (used of Christian God)
to be generous (idiom)/to be magnanimous/Give me a break!
to introduce (sb)/(esp.) to present to the emperor
to ask for instructions
to beg/to beseech/to entreat/entreaty
to do things in a strictly businesslike manner (idiom)
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
excuse me
conducting business impartially (idiom); to act justly
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
